title: GyroBall
detail: A smart ball that reads hand gestures
extended_details:
A ball whose movement is controlled by a Myo armband that reads hand gestures. Ball movement will be actuated through weight-displacement of an inner mass located at the center-of-mass of the ball. The mass will be held in place by springs and displaced using electromagnets fixed along the equator of the ball.

The electromagnets are controlled by an Arduino, which will have a transmitter/receiver unit to communicate the intent of the Myo signals. LEDs on the surface of the ball will indicate when the ball is being controlled, accelerated and decelerated.
